Professional\rdevelopment concentrations are selected and identified based on analysis of student achievement

column9: staff\rwill participate in three non-student days of professional development and five minimum days. Staff training topics are identified by the district office\rand modified by school administration based upon results from teacher surveys and analysis of student assessment results.\r\r2018-19 Staff Training Topics:\r•Common Core Standards and Student engagement•Student Information Systems\r•Student-Centered Teaching Strategies•Technology\r•Data Analysis•Writing Across the Curriculum\r•PLC - Professional Learning Communities\r\rSupplemental site-based staff development takes place throughout the year to support ongoing program implementation. Professional Learning\rCommunities activities emphasized collaboration on common assessments.\r\rMorongo Unified School District offers supplemental training and support for new and ongoing program implementation. In 2018-19
column10: professional\rdevelopment opportunities included:\r•\rBenchmark Data Training•\rIntegrated Math\r•\rCommon Core State Standards - Math•\rSchool Safety\r•\rEnglish Language Arts Writing•\rSocial Studies Training\r•\rIlluminate Training - English Language Arts & Math•\rPBIS/MTSS\r\rNew teachers and teachers not yet fully credentialed are supported by peer coaching and extensive staff development. The district’s BTSA Program\r(Beginning Teacher Support and Assessment) is a state-approved program that offers additional support and assistance to newly credentialed teachers.\rTo support veteran teachers as well as new teachers to the district
column11: Morongo Unified School District offers Peer Assistance and Review (PAR). Experienced\rand knowledgeable veteran teachers provide ongoing assistance to teachers who need to improve their instructional skills
column14: and/or related aspects of their teaching performance.\r\rInstructional assistants and paraprofessionals are occasionally provided specially-designed training by district special education specialists. Training\ractivities generally address topics related to current instructional programs and effective teaching strategies to support current lessons.  ... Unnamed: 11
